content.raw: thanks; I thought the `*` operator was equivalent, but apparently not
content.html: thanks; I thought the * operator was equivalent, but apparently not

update.description: This is a work in progress porting the `gazebo_motor_model` from rotors_simulator to an ignition gazebo system. I've started by duplicating and renaming the `ApplyJointForce` system (e77f0b1) and copying the [UpdateForcesAndMoments()](https://github.com/ethz-asl/rotors_simulator/blob/master/rotors_gazebo_plugins/src/gazebo_motor_model.cpp#L390) function into it (ed4c807), and trying to port pieces over so that it will compile (various commits). Once it compiles, I will work on connecting the publishers and subscribers.
update.title: WIP: Rotors motor model

content.raw: I think we need `worldPose->Rot().RotateVector(Vector3(0, 0, thrust))` here

with the new field names:

~~~
$ ign topic -t /X3/gazebo/command/motor_speed --msgtype ignition.msgs.Actuators -p '
velocity: 0 
velocity: 0
velocity: 0
velocity: 0'
~~~
content.html:
with the new field names:

$ ign topic -t /X3/gazebo/command/motor_speed --msgtype ignition.msgs.Actuators -p '
velocity: 0 
velocity: 0
velocity: 0
velocity: 0'

content.raw:
I believe the commands could be sent from the command-line with something like:

~~~
$ ign topic -t /X3/gazebo/command/motor_speed --msgtype ignition.msgs.Actuators -p '
angular_velocity: 0 
angular_velocity: 0
angular_velocity: 0
angular_velocity: 0'
~~~
content.html:
I believe the commands could be sent from the command-line with something like:

$ ign topic -t /X3/gazebo/command/motor_speed --msgtype ignition.msgs.Actuators -p '
angular_velocity: 0 
angular_velocity: 0
angular_velocity: 0
angular_velocity: 0'

content.raw:
the rotors_motor_model_debug branch has a full copy of the model (instead of `<include>`) with the plugins added

* #!/ignitionrobotics/ign-gazebo/branch/rotors_motor_model_debug?dest=rotors_motor_model#diff

the plugin currently sends hard-coded motor commands to every rotor and it flies upward. we will need to test with a real controller to fully test the math
content.html:
the rotors_motor_model_debug branch has a full copy of the model (instead of <include>) with the plugins added

  • #!/ignitionrobotics/ign-gazebo/branch/rotors_motor_model_debug?dest=rotors_motor_model#diff

the plugin currently sends hard-coded motor commands to every rotor and it flies upward. we will need to test with a real controller to fully test the math
